poem:
"Revelations in the Produce Aisle"

So much depends
upon
the flicker of fingers
through Thai basil,
bags crackling like
dry autumn leaves.
In the spark between
hand squeezed,
the silence of phoneless
space - 
a confession of love,
remembrance of connection.
"How foolish I am," I say,
our lives entwining 
like the roots of the
basil plants.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "My experiment in phonelessness was a failure. It also changed my life In the final update in Rhik’s journey to break his phone addiction, he manages a breakthrough. And a big one. “Do you want to be my girlfriend?” I ask Almond one day. She is leafing through bags of Thai basil, like record store vinyl. “I already am. That’s what this is,” she says patiently, giving my hand a squeeze. Oh, right, I say.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
